intro: Sphingiphila tetramera, commonly known as the four-lobed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Sphingiphila tetramera is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
